Invoice Tracker Pro

- Single-file Python 3 script using ONLY standard library (json, os, datetime, csv, shutil, argparse).
- Saves all data to invoices.json in script directory; creates if missing.
- Main CLI menu via argparse subcommands: list, add, view, edit, delete, print, export.
- Keyboard-first UX: numbered menu options (1-7), enter number to select; supports single-key input via sys.stdin.readline().
- Core data model: List of dicts with keys: id (auto-increment int), date (YYYY-MM-DD), customer (str), items (list of {name:str, qty:float, price:float}), total (float), status (pending/paid).
- "add" subcommand: Interactive prompts for customer, date (default today), multiple items (name/qty/price until blank), auto-calculates total.
- "list" subcommand: Shows grid table of all invoices (ID | Date | Customer | Total | Status), sorted by date desc; "--status pending" filter.
- "view ID": Displays full invoice details with itemized breakdown.
- "edit ID": Re-prompts all fields, recalculates total.
- "delete ID": Confirms then removes.
- "print ID": Formatted print-friendly view (customer header, date, item table, total bold), pauses for printer.
- "export": Generates CSV file (invoices.csv) with all data for accounting software.
- Responsive terminal grid: Uses fixed-width columns, truncates long names, handles variable screen width via shutil.get_terminal_size().
- Persistence: Auto-save after every add/edit/delete; load on startup with error handling for corrupt JSON.
- Validation: Required fields, positive qty/price, valid date format.
- Help text for all commands; "--help" shows full usage.
- Testable: Run "python app.py list" shows empty, "add" creates data, "list" displays grid, "export" creates CSV.
